intro: Spondioides pruriens, commonly known as the itching bush, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small white flowers. The plant is notable for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
